channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Great leaders make space for other great leaders, Rep. Raskin says of Biden
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks Rep. Jamie Raskin what comes next for Democrats after President Biden's withdrawal from the presidential race, and his endorsement of Kamala Harris for the nomination.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin asks Rep. Jamie Raskin what comes next for Democrats after President Biden's withdrawal from the presidential race, and his endorsement of Kamala Harris for the nomination.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Biden drops out of the 2024 race and endorses Harris. What's next for Democrats?
item.description: President Biden has ended his bid for reelection and has officially endorsed Vice President Harris, who says she plans to win the nomination. Republicans are preparing their campaign against her.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden has ended his bid for reelection and has officially endorsed Vice President Harris, who says she plans to win the nomination. Republicans are preparing their campaign against her.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: How will Biden’s decision change the Republican Party’s plans for November?
item.description: NPR's A Martine talks to political analyst and pollster Frank Luntz about how President Biden ending his reelection campaign and endorsing Kamala Harris for the nomination changes the race.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martine talks to political analyst and pollster Frank Luntz about how President Biden ending his reelection campaign and endorsing Kamala Harris for the nomination changes the race.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Sen. Welch called for Biden to step aside, but says it was still a shock when he did
item.description: Sen. Peter Welch of Vermont became a leader in the chorus of others expressing skepticism about President Biden’s ability to campaign, to win and serve four more years.
item.content:encoded: Sen. Peter Welch of Vermont became a leader in the chorus of others expressing skepticism about President Biden’s ability to campaign, to win and serve four more years.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Slovenia's Tadej Pogačar outraced his top rivals to win the Tour de France
item.description: Pogačar also won the sport’s other major race, the Giro D’Italia, earlier this year, making him the first man to win both majors in a season since 1998.
item.content:encoded:
Pogačar also won the sport’s other major race, the Giro D’Italia, earlier this year, making him the first man to win both majors in a season since 1998.

(Image credit: Daniel Cole)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: French Olympians can’t wear hijabs. Human rights group says its discrimination
item.description: A researcher for Amnesty International says France's hijab ban causes systemic issues beyond the Olympic games.
item.content:encoded:
A researcher for Amnesty International says France's hijab ban causes systemic issues beyond the Olympic games.

(Image credit: David Goldman/AP)
item.dc:creator: Reena Advani

item.title: This could be the way we watch movies in the future
item.description: Watching a movie is all about kicking back in a comfy chair with a bucket of popcorn and letting the story unfold. But that might change thanks to virtual reality.
item.content:encoded:
Watching a movie is all about kicking back in a comfy chair with a bucket of popcorn and letting the story unfold. But that might change thanks to virtual reality.

(Image credit: Andreas Rentz)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: When he was 7, a tiny gesture from his grandmother changed his relationship to God
item.description: Shalom Auslander grew up in a strict Orthodox Jewish home. When he was 7, his grandmother offered him something small that made him rethink his entire relationship to religion.
item.content:encoded:
Shalom Auslander grew up in a strict Orthodox Jewish home. When he was 7, his grandmother offered him something small that made him rethink his entire relationship to religion.

(Image credit: Shalom Auslander)
item.dc:creator: Laura Kwerel

item.title: Harris, who is Biden's voice on abortion rights, is likely to raise the volume
item.description: As a candidate, Kamala Harris likely would take an aggressive stance in support of abortion access — hitting former President Donald Trump on an issue where Republicans have been vulnerable.
item.content:encoded:
As a candidate, Kamala Harris likely would take an aggressive stance in support of abortion access — hitting former President Donald Trump on an issue where Republicans have been vulnerable.

(Image credit: Peter Zay)
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Armour

item.title: 6 political takeaways from Biden's decision to step aside
item.description: President Biden is passing the torch to Vice President Harris, which changes the narrative of the race against former President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden is passing the torch to Vice President Harris, which changes the narrative of the race against former President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Bill Pugliano)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro
